H0.text: where did the potter 's wheel first develop. Ancient Egypt

H1.text: where did the potter 's wheel first develop. The Indus Valley Civilization

H2.text: where did the potter 's wheel first develop. Ancient China

H3.text: where did the potter 's wheel first develop. the Near East

A4.text: Egypt is considered as 'being the place of origin of the potter's wheel. It was here that the turntable shaft was lengthened about 3000 BC and a flywheel added.

A5.text: The oldest forms of the potter's wheel (called tourneys or slow wheels) were probably developed as an extension to this procedure. Tournettes, in use around 3500 BC in the Near East, were turned slowly by hand or by foot while coiling a pot.
